PropertyBag.Description: Packages are created to bundle together a group of products that are sold to customers. A package can include any number of products of many types. It is very common to create packages that include a recurring fee and a number of products that may be included as part of the recurring fee, or that are charged on a usage basis. Packages are associated to customers through subscriptions that have a start date, and possibly and end date.
PropertyBag.Name: Package

Property.Description: Represents a collection of products associated with a package. Each element contains modifiers to define how the product should behave for this package. The modifiers allow for the pricing or the event model of the product to be configured.
Property.Name: PackageProducts

Property.Description: Required only if the package has any products with a Recurring event model. This indicates the cycles that should be enabled for a subscription. The list of values represents a Unit of Measure Codes. A list of valid codes can be found in the Metanga UI (go to Configuration -> Units of Measure). Only units of measure based on days or months can be used. The Codes for Units of Measure in Metanga are based on the Unified Code for Units of Measure. You can learn more about this specification here: http://unitsofmeasure.org/ Common values used are: "MO" (Monthly), "ANN" (Annual), "ANN/4" (Quarterly)
Property.Name: RecurringChargeCycle

Property.Description: Defines whether Package will be billed in advance or in arrears. Only applicable if the package has any products with a recurring event model. A charge in advance will trigger the generation of an invoice as soon as a subscriber is enrolled.
Property.Name: AdvanceRecurringEvents

Property.Description: Indicates if there are any payment instrument requirements to subscribe for a package. Can be used by a package that requires a customer to have a credit card on file.
Property.Name: PaymentInfoStatus

Property.Description: Defines the order in which packages are presented in the Metanga UI. A lower rank is presented first. For enrollment sites, packages are normally sorted by this rank. If rank = 0, Metanga will set to the maximum rank of any existing packages, plus 1 Other values can be set, but Metanga will verify that the rank is currently available.
Property.Name: Rank

Property.Description: Indicates that this is a Fixed Term Package. A fixed term package has a pre-defined duration (e.g. 12 months, 5 years, etc.)
Property.Name: IsFixedTerm

Property.Description: The Subscription Term Length allows you to set the duration for a Subscription. Once the Subscription end date arrives, the Subscription will expire.
Property.Name: TermLength

Property.Description: Unit of time for Subscription Term Length The value represents a Unit of Measure Code. A list of valid codes can be found in the Metanga UI (go to Configuration -> Units of Measure). Only units of measure based on days or months can be used. The Codes for Units of Measure in Metanga are based on the Unified Code for Units of Measure. You can learn more about this specification here: http://unitsofmeasure.org/ Common values used are: "MO" (Monthly), "ANN" (Annual), "ANN/4" (Quarterly)
Property.Name: TermTimeUnit

Property.Description: The Subscription Grace Period allows a subscriber or an account representative to terminate a subscription within a specified period of time, without penalty.
Property.Name: GracePeriod

Property.Description: Unit of time for Subscription Grace Period The value represents a Unit of Measure Code. A list of valid codes can be found in the Metanga UI (go to Configuration -> Units of Measure). Only units of measure based on days or months can be used. The Codes for Units of Measure in Metanga are based on the Unified Code for Units of Measure. You can learn more about this specification here: http://unitsofmeasure.org/ Common values used are: "MO" (Monthly), "ANN" (Annual), "ANN/4" (Quarterly)
Property.Name: GracePeriodTimeUnit
